title: Roger Williams National Memorial: Plan Your Visit
body: Explore This Park    Plan Your Visit           Plan Your Visit                   Operating Hours & Seasons               Basic Information               Things to Do               Directions               Calendar of Events         Â    Roger Williams National Memorial is located in downtown Providence, Rhode Island. Here you can discover the story of Roger Williams, the founder of Providence and an early proponent of Freedom of Religion. The visitor center features an exhibit as well as a short film. The grounds of the National Memorial also includes a number of wayside exhibits.   The visitor center also provides information about nearby sites and attractions, and is a great place to begin your exploration of downtown Providence. Please see the links above for more information about your visit.
